definition: to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: He affixed his seal to the contract.
The manager annexed his seal to the document.
I forget to close the top of the stamp pad.
Have you got any stamps in your passport?
The paid checks are stamped"Paid"with the date of payment.
sentences.chinese: 有偿的检查被盖印“有偿”与付款日。

sentences.english: The custom officer looks at the stamp in his passport.
sentences.chinese: 海关官员查看了他护照的盖印。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo obtain a effective and practical method for identification of photosensitive stamp mark.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨光敏印章盖印印文形成机理，总结检验方法。

sentences.english: The receipt is stamped, so just fill in the information.
sentences.chinese: 收据已经盖印，所以只要填上资料就好。

sentences.english: The receipt is only valid when signed by a person of company with the company chop.
sentences.chinese: 收据须经本公司职员签署及盖印方为有效。

definition: red ink paste used for seal
signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
